scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. Previously, when one of the team members, Alex, said, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time,' you responded by encouraging the team to stay focused and work together. During a team meeting, [Monica] slammed her pen on the table and added, 'Even if we try our best, there's no way we can meet this deadline.' [Bob] nodded in agreement, looking equally concerned. You suggested taking a pause to rethink the approach. Now, with the team gathered again, [Monica] leaned back in her chair, crossing her arms, and said, 'So, what’s the new grand plan?' You motivated the team by recalling past successes and urging them to tackle the challenge head-on. However, the tension is still palpable. [Bob] leaned forward, sighing, 'I just don't see how we can pull this off without burning out.' You emphasized the need to push through, recalling past tight deadlines. The team still feels the weight of the challenge.
scenes.description: [Monica] rolls her eyes and says, 'Pushing through isn’t the same as burning out. We can't keep doing this!' [Bob] nods in agreement, looking visibly stressed.

options.text: Let's take a moment to breathe. We need to balance our workload and mental health.
options.analysis: You prioritized the team's well-being and suggested a balanced approach, showing high empathy and good emotional perception.

options.text: I understand your point, Monica. Maybe we should assess our progress and adjust our plan accordingly.
options.analysis: You acknowledged Monica's concerns and proposed a practical step to reassess progress, demonstrating good self-regulation and social skills.

options.text: I know it's tough, but we need to stay focused and dedicated. We can handle this if we stay strong.
options.analysis: You focused on motivating the team by insisting on dedication, showing high motivation but lower empathy and emotional perception.
